description:
This module teaches writing and critical thinking through a
critical exploration of the notion of cosmopolitanism and its
relation to colonialism. Topics discussed include the origin
of cosmopolitanism, the relevance of cosmopolitanism as a
moral ideal in the age of globalization, and the formation of
cultural identity among diasporic Asians. The module thus
provides the chance for students to reflect on the notion of
global citizenship in the contemporary world, as well as
their responsibilities as cosmopolitan citizens.
title: Writing and Critical Thinking: Colonialism and Cosmopolitanism
